intro: Disciphania lobata, commonly known as the broad-lobed disciphania, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Malvaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa and is characterized by its palmate leaves with lobed margins. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale pink in color. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens and greenhouses.
